group_1.textLeft: ...Why I like researching history?@Well...
It's not like I want to make a giant discovery, or@leave my name in history, or anything like that.
I just enjoy KNOWING.
What feelings the people who lived through past@eras had...
What kind of circumstances they lived in...
The protagonists of history are the people who@actually lived through it, after all.
So I wouldn't want to make MYSELF into that@protagonist.

group_1.textRight: ...That IS the way you always tend to act, isn't it?
Always one step removed...
...as if you're observing everyone— even yourself—@from an objective standpoint.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah! I'd rather stay an observer than be a@protagonist.

group_1.textRight: The perfect model of a researcher.

group_1.textLeft: It's easier that way. ...Honestly, you could even say@I'm running away.

group_1.textRight: ...From what?

group_1.textLeft: ...I wonder.
From crying, laughing, getting mad, that sort of@thing?
...Oh, yeah. That's still how I'm approaching the film,@too.
I haven't started thinking, "oh my gosh, being a@main character is fun too!" or anything.
I do want to know more about the era when@Tsukihiko and Ruri lived, though.

group_1.textRight: I see... when I think back on it, that's how it was@then, too.

group_1.narration: "I want... to make the excavation of that kofun a reality."
"I want to feel the breath of those people buried in history!"

group_1.textRight: You didn't want to become famous as the discoverer.
You just wanted to see what was inside. That's all.
A scholar, through and through.
...The way you put a bit of distance between yourself@and the events around you...
I'm fond of it.

group_1.textLeft: Really?

group_1.textRight: It makes it easy to spend time around you.

group_1.textLeft: That so.
...Really, I should be the one thanking you for back@then.

group_1.textRight: Oh? Did I do anything in particular?

group_1.textLeft: You believed in me when I'd lost faith in myself,@didn't you?

group_1.textRight: Ah...@right, now that you mention it.

group_1.narration: After realizing that the hill behind our school@was a kofun, Komachi wrote a paper that@took even the experts by surprise,@and enacted an excavation of the site.
Right now, she's talking about a period of time where@she was at a loss for how to continue with said paper.
Komachi was absolutely the protagonist of that story.@I only played a very minor role.

group_1.textRight: ...By the way.

group_1.textLeft: Hm?

group_1.textRight: Talking about your wish happened to remind me...
Perhaps you found Tsukihiko's diary thanks to your@personal magic?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah...@I think so, too.

group_1.textRight: Since aspiring director Mihono can use@stage-direction magic,
I imagine that your magic is most likely...

group_1.textLeft: Discovering relics buried in history?

group_1.textRight: You had the same hunch, I take it?
Effortlessly finding valuable old documents,@for instance...

group_1.textLeft: Yep. That sort of thing's been happening over and@over since I became a Magical Girl.
I did get the feeling that it wasn't a coincidence.
...Welp.@Guess this is my magic, huh?

group_1.textRight: Is that a problem?

group_1.textLeft: I mean, I guess it's not bad? It's useful for research,@after all.
I'm more interested in yours. What could it be?

group_1.textRight: Hmm...
Well, I do believe it's related to my wish.

group_1.narration: "And finally, Temari Kira. What will your wish be?"
After Komachi and Mihono made their wishes,@I replied with mine:
"I want the words I weave to reach somebody's heart."

group_1.textLeft: You have quite a taste for the literary arts, yes?
So do you mean that you want your works to attract@readers?

group_1.textRight: Correct.
...That said, I don't particularly care about writing@best-sellers.
Specifically, I want the poems, novels, critiques and@so on that I put out into the world as an author...
...to reach the people who need those works from@the bottom of their hearts.
...Even if that happens to be long after my death.

group_1.textLeft: The contract is complete.
From now on, the works and essays woven together@by your words...
...should be guaranteed to reach the heart of anyone@who needs them.
...You barely hesitated, didn't you?

group_1.textRight: Wish-granting devils and the like have been a topic@in fiction for centuries.
So perhaps I'd come to terms with the idea already?

group_1.textLeft: You're usually so aloof, but in that moment, you@looked dead serious.

group_1.textRight: I only partake in fiction and literary critique for my@own enjoyment, really...
But it's only enjoyable if I'm serious about it.

group_1.textLeft: That wish is gonna come true for sure!@Just like mine and Mihono's.
...Though your magic's the only unknown factor left.

group_1.textRight: My version of Mihono's "stage direction" power, yes.
My ability as a Magical Girl...

group_1.textLeft: Yeah.
Well, we had no idea about my magic until just a@little while ago, either.
I'm sure we'll find out soon.
